headline: Sarah's Ambrosia Fruit Salad
description: Ambrosia salad loaded with marshmallows, coconut, pineapple, and mandarin oranges is a refreshing salad to serve at summer picnics.
name: Sarah's Ambrosia Fruit Salad
recipeIngredient: 0.75 cup shredded coconut, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Mix pineapple, oranges, sour cream, marshmallows, and coconut together in a bowl. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until flavors blend, 2 hours to overnight.

review.reviewBody: I also added maraschino cherry halves.
It was easy and so delicious! Every time I make this my guests love it! It's a Win Win!
My mother used to make this quick & easy dessert whenI was a child. I have looking for the recipe for years! Taste just like my mother's. Thank you to who ever submitted it!

An excellent, kid-friendly dessert that you can prepare a day in advance for large social events. Very easy to throw together with ingredients in the pantry. However, it makes *a lot*. Definitely halve the servings for a reasonable amount of food, otherwise the ambrosia amounts are exceptional.
It was ok, Think I'll look for a different recipe.

This salad was a big hit with my girls throughout their childhood years, prepared for them by their beloved Grandma Eileen. since the salad was always an easy one for her to make, it was one we saw at most family get togethers. Donâ€™t skip the coconut, it lends a bit of a chewy texture, varying textures being the main component of this salad. Iâ€™ve made it with fresh blueberries, dried cranberries instead of coconut, using the light sour cream gives the salad a slimmer calorie count but whatever you do, donâ€™t (ever) skip the mini marshmallows!

Iâ€™ve been making this salad since I was a teenager. Almost 60 nowðŸ˜Š My mom passed it down to her children. Her recipe only differs by using crushed pineapple in heavy syrup vs pineapple tidbits . My siblings and I love it still!!!
It was very light and flavourful. I added about 1/2 cup of maraschino cherries cut in half for taste and color.
I add one can of fruit cocktail and a large jar of maraschino cherries, both drained.

I was skeptical about sour cream in a fruit salad but the sweetness of the fruit counter balances it perfectly and it tasted delicious. I substituted maraschino cherries for the coconut though and it was a welcome addition.
Exactly what I was looking for in a classic ambrosia salad! Family loved it for Christmas. I drained my fruit overnight and it was the perfect consistency.
Good pie. First time I've made homemade pumpkin pie. I added extra on all the spices and included Allspice on my second attempt. Husband gave it a thumbs up. Thanks!
This is the retro recipe my sister had from the 60's. I sometimes add grapes to it also.

My family loves this salad. Iâ€™ve been making it for years. I even make extra to send home with my son who is grown now. I follow this recipe, but I add 1/2 -1 cup of pecans. It gives it a little crunch and boosts the flavor.
Super easy and delicious!
I make this every year for Thanksgiving and I believe the sour cream makes it! you would think it would be too heavy, but the fruit really lightens it up.
no changes. yes again
I made this dish at Easter and everyone loved it!

Iâ€™ve made this many times. Itâ€™s a big hit at pot lucks on the beach or a friendâ€™s boat. We cruise full time and availability of ingredients can be a challenge. Iâ€™ve used the large marshmallows and quartered them, and Iâ€™ve also used plain yogurt if I donâ€™t have enough sour cream (although itâ€™s easy to make your own with milk and/or lemon juice or white vinegar, in a pinch). Delicious! I was looking for a recipe similar to the one my mom used to make, and this is it! Sometimes I add grated coconut as well.
It was wonderful! Iâ€™ll definitely make it again! So easy!

Delicious! I was told it was the best Ambrosia salad one of my friends had ever had. I drained the fruit overnight and added a container of Cool Whip in addition to thesour cream. I used the number of cans indicated even though Canadian sizes are different.
My whole framily & friends loved it ! And, will I'll be making it again !
Absolutely delicious. Amazing combination. Would serve this at any gathering.

Mine was a little watery (probably didnâ€™t drain fruit well enough) so I added a small package of vanilla pudding mix. It worked perfectly to soak up the extra juice and gave an extra vanilla flavor.

It was excellent and I made it exactly as per instructions. It keeps for several days but the juices do start coming out, not a problem I just added a couple more marshmallows the last day of eating. I would highly recommended this recipe.
This recipe calls for more ingredients than the cream can hold. With some common sense adjustments to the number of cans I opened, it was fine.
It was a HIT!!!
YUM, YUM, YUM! And SO easy. Does make a ton.
It was so good. I will definitely make it again and again. Thank you for sharing the recipe.

I added a small jar of maraschino cherries, cut in half. I also reduced the sour cream to 8 ozs., added an 8-oz. container of whipped topping, and toasted the coconut beforehand. Everyone really like it.
I omitted the tropical fruit and added extra mandarin oranges.
I've made this recipe many times for potlucks and it's always enjoyed. I like to add extra coconut - the kids seem to like the coconut flavor.

Excellent: easy and tasty. I like it with sour cream ( I think the frozen Redi-whip makes it too sweet). I do drain the fruit overnight so it isn't watery and include pecans for texture. Also now add strawberries instead of maraschino cherries because I can't seem to avoid getting the ambrosia pink otherwise. My Book Club loves it.
We added Bananas! and used a fresh pineapple

I made this for a baby shower today and it was a big hit! It was gone within minutes! Sooooo easy to make too. It's not only tasty but appealing to the eye with the mandarin orange and pastel colored marshmallows. I'll definitely be making this often for social gatherings.
I made this for my family but since I am highly allergic to pineapple, I couldn't try it for myself. Is there something I can substitute for thAny suggestions would be appreciated.

Really yummy! We use Greek yogurt instead of sour cream - I used about 10 ounces of plain Greek yogurt plus a 10 oz container of thawed cool whip. Gave a great fluffy texture. I'd made this recipe before and it was a bit soupy, so I made sure to drain the fruit really well. The natural juices that are released when the salad is stirred will add juicy sweetness. We have a couple of non-coconut, so I left it out this time. Still turned out great, but I think the coconut would've helped soak up some of the liquid. I think the cool whip did the job this time around, adding the fluffy texture without too much extra flavor or sweetness. I used pineapple chunks, they were too big. Gotta hunt down the tidbits...
Awesome recipe and everyone loves it.

This has become my signature "pot luck" contribution. I use equal parts cool whip and sour cream. One preparation change I made is after draining, I leave the fruit in the colander placed in a larger bowl. I let this drain overnight in the fridge. This step removes at least another cup and a half of liquid. The salad then is less runny.

Love Allrecipes!! Always read the critiques. Now all of sudden when I click "more" to read the entire rating of an individual, it will not open up. I always was able to do this until lately. Any suggestions what is wrong?

I made this for our church luncheon. Everyone loved it and it makes a LOT!! Make sure your drain the canned fruit several times. The only thing I did different was to add 8oz of sour cream and 8 oz of cool whip instead of 16oz of sour cream. Next time I will add one cup of coconut~ it is delicious!!

I've made this many times through the years, with different variations depending on who was coming over to eat. Sometimes I have had to add more ingredients for some in a separate bowl. My daughter-in-laws like it with plumped raisons and apple chunks added, the grandkids like it best when I use cool whip instead of sour cream, my brother -in-law likes it with a yogurt instead of sour cream...I personally like it with halved green grapes, banana slices and pecan pieces. One of my sisters uses vanilla pudding (straight out the box) instead of cool whip, yogurt or sour cream. Best when refrigerated at least 24 hours.
Made this salad and everyone loved it. Drained pineapples, and oranges so the salad won't be runny. Taste better if you make it night before instead of 2 hours prior to event...

Love ambrosia salad! So delicious. This recipe was good. I substituted half the sour cream with cool whip (8oz sour cream and 8 oz cool whip), and it turned out perfectly to our tastes. Have made several times. Thanks!

Does any one know if the salad will firm up a bit after chilling? Mine became real soupy looking the more and more I tossed it. I have it in fridge now I am just trying to figure out if I should add pudding to it to thicken it up a bit or something?

Excellent. Made mostly as listed, I used flavored mini marshmallows (orange, strawberry, lemon & lime) and you definitely need to let chill 2+ hours or more so flavors blend. Will definitely make again!
I use crushed pineapple instead and I add maraschino cherries!

Different than the Ambrosia salads I'm used to. Less sweet, and I could only find crushed pineapple, not tidbits, so mine was more watery. I added chopped pecans, and that was a MUST DO! Enjoyed this, even though it's not what I'm used to.
LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS SALAD!! It's best served ICE cold. I add 1 cup of shredded coconut instead of 3/4 cup. I also use fat free sour cream and the canned fruits are in their own juices.

This has always been a favorite salad of mine. I made as written, but only added coconut to three-fourths of the salad and left the other fourth without for my coconut disliking guys. This recipe does make a very large bowl and it was good without getting watery for about 3 days. Just make sure you drain your fruit really well. I saved the juice from the fruit and used it to make gelatin. A delicious salad that will grace my table again.
One of my most favorite "church" salads. I sometimes make this fluffy by folding in a small container of Cool Whip.
